Output 1.1: Operational multi-stakeholder platforms are supporting INRM at district and regional levels 1.1.2 Creation and or Establishment of multi stakeholder platforms : four(4) at the district Level and Eight(8) at S/C Level. a. Two trainings /meetings for 60 profiled multi stakeholders’ platforms (MSP)s on value chain development SLM, INRM. b. Exposure/ learning visit to Elgon region/ Kiryandongo for knowledge sharing and strengthening existing multi-stakeholder platforms at the local level for 30 stakeholders, focused on SLM, INRM (FMNR, energy saving technologies and value chains) c. Conduct review of multi-stakeholders platforms on INRM/SLM in other parts of the region and globally to identify best practices and use them to inform project process & Prepare guidelines for operationalization of the platforms. d. Establishing & Operationalizing the platforms. e. Support development and operationalization of National Communication Strategy related to SLM/INRM priority issues & establishment/maintenance pf project Website f. Support implementation of Action plans for the MSPs based on feasible Value chains 1.1.3 Work together with Ministry of Karamoja Affairs (MKA) and other relevant ministries/stakeholders (i.e. MLHUD, MTIC, etc) to bring national platforms at the regional level and facilitate knowledge exchange and collaboration events on INRM/SLM (harmonization of approaches, joint awareness, capacity development, and other inter-linkages with regional platforms (i.e. Pastoralists Knowledge Hub, World Initiative on Sustainable Pastoralism) a. Consultancy services to review coherence for INRM and SLM across government policy, planning and decision-making processes and structures, and developing recommendations for improved policy coherence at district and regional level b. Convene stakeholders meetings and other policy dialogues on thematic issues of INRM/SLM, food security, communicating project progress, identify actions needed to achieve programme objectives, and discuss institutional options for effective project implementation. c. Develop awareness materials and advocacy tools and products, exchanges on experiences and lessons learned to influence regional networks and international and national development models (briefing notes, annual reports, guidelines, regional workshops) 1.1.4 Train 12 district officials per district on budgeting guidelines and integrating new things into local gov’t plans and budgets, (particularly in integrating INRM and SLM, CC resilience, LD and BD loss prevention)-in Moroto,Nakapiripirit and Nabilatuk Districts. b) Support for integration of priorities expressed by local multi-stakeholder platforms into the district planning and budgeting process including review options for increase in budget lines for INMR and SLM in accordance with various national action plans (food security, SLM strategic investment plan, climate resilience, preventing land degradation and biodiversity loss) c) Conduct a gender analysis to inform MSP priority setting mechanisms and integration of stakeholder priorities into District planning and Budgeting 1.1.5 ) Produce and disseminate demand driven knowledge management products to document project achievements and impacts in the form of success stories, best practices, lessons learned, case studies (print, radio, you tube videos, dramas, social media, webinars, postcodes, blogs, etc.) Output 1.2: Adequate legal instruments enabling INRM, land use planning and enforcement in place
